before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ikus","text":"Prepare NGM agar media and fill maintenance plates for raising N2 Bristol C. elegans on BW25113 background strain ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

29207.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fm6uj","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"817ee","text":"LB Broth contents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k94l","text":"4 g NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"234vn","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bf8pp","text":"2 g Yeast Extract","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvoqg","text":"dH2O to 400 mL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mtd7","text":"Add liquid LB to a tube or flask and add the appropriate antibiotic (if required) to the correct concentration (see table below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43opf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1cur","text":"Antibiotic Concentrations","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ft1j","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqaa7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ormh","text":"Note: If you intend to do a mini-prep you will usually want to start 2 mL in a falcon tube, but for larger preps you might want to use as much as a litre of LB in a 2 L Erlenmeyer flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colWidths":[50,50],"data":[["   \u003cb\u003eCommonly Used Antibiotics\u003c/b\u003e   ","   \u003cb\u003eRecommended Concentration\u003c/b\u003e   "],["  Ampicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Bleocin  ","  5 µg/mL  "],["  Carbenicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Chloramphenicol  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Coumermycin  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Gentamycin  ","  10 µg/mL  "],["  Kanamycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Spectinomycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Tetracycline  ","  10 µg/mL  "]],"guid":"D0D30710F76111E9A71C91C23E5C71A8","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"21mge","text":"Antibiotic concentrations","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qml6","text":"Using a sterile inoculation loop, select a single colony from your bacteria streaked LB agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36b3c","text":"Dip the inoculation loop into the liquid LB and swirl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v4vj","text":"Discard the inoculation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets20","text":"Loosely cover the culture with sterile aluminium foil or a cap that is not air tight as bacteria needs air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fs0c","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) in a shaking incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qs89","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lfjb","text":"Measure the optical density of the bacterial culture at 600nm wavelength using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pct0","text":"Record the OD600 three times and calculate average, use LB Broth as Blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47333.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"309bv","text":" Book the autoclave (notebook on top of the machine).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jj73","text":" Take clean flasks from the glass kitchen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1djq8","text":" Measure all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the flask (Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Also, the cholesterol is kept in the fridge.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du0k","text":" Once water is added mix thoroughly and label with autoclave tape (‘NGM Rm 5009’). Make sure the bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1upm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n4ll","text":"     - Turn ON the autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hcii","text":"     - Make sure that the autoclave’s probe bottle is the same size as the largest bottle you use and fill it with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6m9aj","text":"     - Place the temperature probe in it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64o03","text":"     - Fill up the autoclave with water until it reaches the grill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tak","text":"     - Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15kuc","text":"     - Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f30mb","text":"     - Use ‘media’ program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3da1n","text":"     - Press START.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b3ll","text":"     - It will take about 2 hours for a 500ml bottle to autoclave and about 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3or95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do41r","text":" When autoclave is complete, remove the probe flask ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9f79r","text":" Make sure to wear gloves as the flask will be hot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe27u","text":" Let the agar to cool to around 55°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rb6n","text":" Add the post autoclave reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3iou4","text":" Mix it well and start pouring onto imaging plates following the Protocol for Plate Pouring.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qt0f","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v7q2","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8er1s","text":"Phenotyping the acute behavioural response of Caenorhabditis elegans (N2 Bristol) to E. coli single-gene deletion mutants (Keio Collection, BW25113 parent strain), in both the presence and absence of antioxidants ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":85,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"509g1","text":"(Trolox, NAC, vitamin C and resveratrol). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42fkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q5cs","text":"Videos are recorded at 25 fps on the laboratory’s (Hydra) imaging rig, immediately after worms are picked onto imaging plates, for a total of 36 minutes, with blue-light stimulus delivered for 10 seconds at the 30, 31 and 32 minute timepoints.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"a92mg","text":"Read through the whole protocol before starting, as the sections are not in chronological order","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: antioxidant, C. elegans, Keio, bacteria, behaviour, phenotype

plates)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87lr0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9afqr","text":"For )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jtt9","text":"- 2.5g bactopeptone (ref: BD 21167 lot BCBM1702V)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mo8g","text":"- 1L H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":6,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anr13","text":"- Salts (post-autoclave):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b34he","text":"    25mL KH2PO4, pH=6.0 (ref : SIGMA P0662-2,5KG)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":11,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9lko","text":" NaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u5o2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bas08","text":"50mg/mL Kanamycin (in water, filter 0.2mm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"de0su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4f97","text":"Antioxidants (Trolox, NAC and Vitamin C):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"haqv","text":"- Final concentration (in 4mL M9) : 500 and 1000 mg/mL status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"faak5","text":"Make 1L normal Nematode Growth Media (NGM) agar, following the protocol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7tog","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8hjq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":47333,"title":"Making normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eMaking normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"making-normal-ngm-for-imaging-plates-cabreiro-lab-bsgdnbs6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":3},"type_id":1,"guid":"FD29DBC0753811ECBDE4F93F901D4E7A"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvr8g","text":"Under a hood, pour 4mL NGM agar into each well of 25 x 6-well plates (imaging plates), and leave to dry until they lose between 3 - 5% of their original weight at pouring (approximately 2 hours). Once dry, store at 4°C until seeding bacterial lawns. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj4k6","text":"In Erlenmeyer flasks containing 50ml LB broth, separately inoculate overnight cultures of E. coli BW25113 (Keio Collection parent strain) and the desired bacterial mutant to test from a single colony picked from streaked LB agar plates. Add 50uL Kanamycin to the flask inoculated with the mutant bacteria. Place in a shaking incubator at 37°C (200rpm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":90,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhcqg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7m5qq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":29207,"title":"Inoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eInoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"inoculating-a-liquid-bacterial-culture-8rxhv7n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":7},"type_id":1,"guid":"64F31D10753A11ECBDE4F93F901D4E7A"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ata5d","text":"The next day, remove the cultures from the shaking incubator and inoculate a second round of overnight cultures from the first, only this time do not add Kanamycin to the mutant bacterial culture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ieo3","text":"When seeding plates, remove the plates and the cultures from 4°C storage, and leave on the bench for approximately 30 minutes to acclimate to room temperature and remove condensation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fh2js","text":"Seed the plates each with 30μL of bacterial culture in the middle of each well of the 6-well imaging plate (using aseptic technique and working under a microbiological hood)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8h4th","text":"Pipette 30μL of bacterial culture into the centre of each well in the 6-well imaging plates, taking care not to damage the agar with the pipette tip. Seed half of the 6-well plates with BW25113 control, and the other half with BW25113ΔfepD lawns","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9aaal","text":"Using a platinum pick, gently pick 30 L4-stage N2 Bristol C. elegans onto each maintenance plate, and store in an incubator at 20°C (Monday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":58,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iab7","text":"After 24 hours, remove the adult worms, leaving the eggs behind to hatch into L1 larvae (Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32bf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjjms","text":"Bleach-synchronise the worms by performing an egg prep, following the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmbv","text":"(Friday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9j7r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anl5o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":[{"affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""},"is_verified_author":null,"is_verified_user":null,"link":null,"name":"Saul Prep   for Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eEgg Prep   for Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","type_id":1,"uri":"egg-prep-for-bleach-synchronization-cabreiro-lab-bsgfnbtn","version_data":{"code":"bsgfnbtn","has_approved_merge_request":false,"has_pending_merge_request":false,"id":0,"is_parent_public":false,"is_same_owner":false,"merge_request":null,"parent_id":null,"parent_uri":null,"version_class":47335}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mde5","text":"At around noon the next day, wash L1 larvae off the empty plate with a few mL of M9 using a glass Pasteur pipette, and re-feed onto BW-seeded maintenance plates. Incubate at 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nvv8","text":"(Saturday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8sic7","text":"Prior to tracking, ensure that the imaging cave air conditioning is turned on (and there has not been a power-cut) and also empty the dehumidifier waste water tray (see pre-imaging checklist)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vfql","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fil67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b5et0","text":"Normal temperature range: 19 - 21°C","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"47ev1","text":"Humidity: 35 - 45%","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kbv9","text":"Remove the plate of age-matched (Day1 adult) worms from 20°C incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkd7o","text":"Using a platinum pick, gently but swiftly transfer 10 worms onto the edge of the bacterial lawn of each well in a single imaging plate at a time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d954o","text":"Quickly transport the 6-well plates to the imaging cave and place them under the rigs. Ensure that the plate is in the correct orientation for the recording so that the positions of each of the wells under the cameras is correct and matches the recorded treatment information in the metadata","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m2f4","text":"Track worm behaviour on each well for a total of 36 minutes (at 25 fps), applying a 10-second blue-light stimulus at the 30th, 31st and 32nd minute timepoints","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"81efb","text":"Leave under a hood to dry for approximately 30 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5arii","text":"Remove the seeded plates from 4°C and dry under a hood for 30 minutes to remove condensation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vulg","text":"At least 1 - 2 hours prior to adding worms and imaging, prepare the antioxidants (see Materials section for details of antioxidant preparation) and exogenously add on top of the lawns in each well, to yield a final concentration of 500μg/mL antioxidant solution (in either EtOH or H2O) in 4mL NGM agar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":282,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae6p8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"512ct","text":"The following day, remove the cultures from the shaking incubator and store at 4°C until used for seeding imaging plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9a7ls","text":"Leave the seeded plate to dry for 20 minutes under the hood, then transfer to a 25°C incubator and leave to grow for a further 7 hours and 40 minutes (for a total of 8 hours lawn growth time), before storing at 4°C until tracking (max 2 days)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
